results:
Based on the search results, here are the key bibliographic details for the first edition of Brave New World published by Chatto & Windus in 1932:

## Publication Details

Brave New World was published in 1932 by Chatto & Windus in London. The novel was written in 1931 and published in 1932.

## Physical Description

The first edition was published in blue cloth with the top edge stained blue and featured an iconic blue and white illustrated jacket. The book contains 306 pages and is in octavo format.

The original binding features blue boards with gilt titling and decoration. The book has a blue top edge with the bottom edge of pages untrimmed.

## Limited Edition

Before the general trade edition, Chatto & Windus offered a signed, numbered run of 324 copies, with 314 released for general sale. These signed, limited deluxe first edition copies were numbered and signed by Aldous Huxley.

## Pricing

The dust jacket was correctly priced at '7s. 6d.net' on the front lower flap.

## ISBN Information

Note that ISBNs were not introduced until 1967, so the 1932 first edition would not have had an ISBN. Books from this era are identified by publisher, year, and other bibliographic details rather than ISBN numbers.

## Publisher Information

**Publisher:** Chatto & Windus  
**Location:** London  
**Year:** 1932  
**Format:** Octavo  
**Pages:** 306  
**Binding:** Blue cloth with gilt lettering  
**Dust Jacket:** Blue and white illustrated design  

This first edition is highly collectible, with signed limited edition copies often commanding above $7,000 and regular first editions in good condition ranging up to several thousand dollars.
